speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: SCENE II. The island. Before PROSPERO'S cell.

speaker: GONZALO
text_entry: Enter PROSPERO and MIRANDA

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: If by your art, my dearest father, you have

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Put the wild waters in this roar, allay them.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: The sky, it seems, would pour down stinking pitch,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: But that the sea, mounting to the welkin's cheek,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Dashes the fire out. O, I have suffered

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: With those that I saw suffer: a brave vessel,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Who had, no doubt, some noble creature in her,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Dash'd all to pieces. O, the cry did knock

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Against my very heart. Poor souls, they perish'd.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Had I been any god of power, I would

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Have sunk the sea within the earth or ere

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: It should the good ship so have swallow'd and

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: The fraughting souls within her.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Be collected:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: No more amazement: tell your piteous heart

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: There's no harm done.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: O, woe the day!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: No harm.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I have done nothing but in care of thee,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of thee, my dear one, thee, my daughter, who

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Art ignorant of what thou art, nought knowing

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of whence I am, nor that I am more better

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Than Prospero, master of a full poor cell,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And thy no greater father.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: More to know

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Did never meddle with my thoughts.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: 'Tis time

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I should inform thee farther. Lend thy hand,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And pluck my magic garment from me. So:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Lays down his mantle

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Lie there, my art. Wipe thou thine eyes; have comfort.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The direful spectacle of the wreck, which touch'd

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The very virtue of compassion in thee,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I have with such provision in mine art

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: So safely ordered that there is no soul--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: No, not so much perdition as an hair

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Betid to any creature in the vessel

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which thou heard'st cry, which thou saw'st sink. Sit down;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For thou must now know farther.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: You have often

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Begun to tell me what I am, but stopp'd

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: And left me to a bootless inquisition,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Concluding 'Stay: not yet.'

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The hour's now come;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The very minute bids thee ope thine ear;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Obey and be attentive. Canst thou remember

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A time before we came unto this cell?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I do not think thou canst, for then thou wast not

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Out three years old.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Certainly, sir, I can.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: By what? by any other house or person?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of any thing the image tell me that

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hath kept with thy remembrance.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: 'Tis far off

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: And rather like a dream than an assurance

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: That my remembrance warrants. Had I not

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Four or five women once that tended me?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou hadst, and more, Miranda. But how is it

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: That this lives in thy mind? What seest thou else

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: In the dark backward and abysm of time?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If thou remember'st aught ere thou camest here,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: How thou camest here thou mayst.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: But that I do not.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Twelve year since, Miranda, twelve year since,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thy father was the Duke of Milan and

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A prince of power.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Sir, are not you my father?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thy mother was a piece of virtue, and

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: She said thou wast my daughter; and thy father

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Was Duke of Milan; and thou his only heir

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And princess no worse issued.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: O the heavens!

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: What foul play had we, that we came from thence?

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Or blessed was't we did?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Both, both, my girl:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: By foul play, as thou say'st, were we heaved thence,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: But blessedly holp hither.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: O, my heart bleeds

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: To think o' the teen that I have turn'd you to,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Which is from my remembrance! Please you, farther.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: My brother and thy uncle, call'd Antonio--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I pray thee, mark me--that a brother should

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Be so perfidious!--he whom next thyself

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of all the world I loved and to him put

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The manage of my state; as at that time

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Through all the signories it was the first

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And Prospero the prime duke, being so reputed

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: In dignity, and for the liberal arts

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Without a parallel; those being all my study,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The government I cast upon my brother

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And to my state grew stranger, being transported

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And rapt in secret studies. Thy false uncle--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Dost thou attend me?

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Sir, most heedfully.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Being once perfected how to grant suits,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: How to deny them, who to advance and who

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To trash for over-topping, new created

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The creatures that were mine, I say, or changed 'em,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Or else new form'd 'em; having both the key

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of officer and office, set all hearts i' the state

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To what tune pleased his ear; that now he was

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The ivy which had hid my princely trunk,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And suck'd my verdure out on't. Thou attend'st not.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: O, good sir, I do.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I pray thee, mark me.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I, thus neglecting worldly ends, all dedicated

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To closeness and the bettering of my mind

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With that which, but by being so retired,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: O'er-prized all popular rate, in my false brother

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Awaked an evil nature; and my trust,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Like a good parent, did beget of him

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A falsehood in its contrary as great

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As my trust was; which had indeed no limit,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A confidence sans bound. He being thus lorded,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Not only with what my revenue yielded,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: But what my power might else exact, like one

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Who having into truth, by telling of it,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Made such a sinner of his memory,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To credit his own lie, he did believe

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: He was indeed the duke; out o' the substitution

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And executing the outward face of royalty,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With all prerogative: hence his ambition growing--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Dost thou hear?

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Your tale, sir, would cure deafness.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To have no screen between this part he play'd

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And him he play'd it for, he needs will be

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Absolute Milan. Me, poor man, my library

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Was dukedom large enough: of temporal royalties

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: He thinks me now incapable; confederates--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: So dry he was for sway--wi' the King of Naples

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To give him annual tribute, do him homage,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Subject his coronet to his crown and bend

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The dukedom yet unbow'd--alas, poor Milan!--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To most ignoble stooping.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: O the heavens!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Mark his condition and the event; then tell me

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If this might be a brother.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I should sin

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: To think but nobly of my grandmother:

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Good wombs have borne bad sons.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Now the condition.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The King of Naples, being an enemy

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To me inveterate, hearkens my brother's suit;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which was, that he, in lieu o' the premises

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of homage and I know not how much tribute,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Should presently extirpate me and mine

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Out of the dukedom and confer fair Milan

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With all the honours on my brother: whereon,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A treacherous army levied, one midnight

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fated to the purpose did Antonio open

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The gates of Milan, and, i' the dead of darkness,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The ministers for the purpose hurried thence

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Me and thy crying self.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Alack, for pity!

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I, not remembering how I cried out then,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Will cry it o'er again: it is a hint

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: That wrings mine eyes to't.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hear a little further

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And then I'll bring thee to the present business

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which now's upon's; without the which this story

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Were most impertinent.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Wherefore did they not

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: That hour destroy us?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Well demanded, wench:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: My tale provokes that question. Dear, they durst not,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: So dear the love my people bore me, nor set

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A mark so bloody on the business, but

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With colours fairer painted their foul ends.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: In few, they hurried us aboard a bark,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Bore us some leagues to sea; where they prepared

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A rotten carcass of a boat, not rigg'd,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Nor tackle, sail, nor mast; the very rats

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Instinctively had quit it: there they hoist us,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To cry to the sea that roar'd to us, to sigh

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To the winds whose pity, sighing back again,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Did us but loving wrong.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Alack, what trouble

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Was I then to you!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: O, a cherubim

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou wast that did preserve me. Thou didst smile.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Infused with a fortitude from heaven,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: When I have deck'd the sea with drops full salt,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Under my burthen groan'd; which raised in me

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: An undergoing stomach, to bear up

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Against what should ensue.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: How came we ashore?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: By Providence divine.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Some food we had and some fresh water that

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A noble Neapolitan, Gonzalo,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Out of his charity, being then appointed

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Master of this design, did give us, with

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Rich garments, linens, stuffs and necessaries,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which since have steaded much; so, of his gentleness,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Knowing I loved my books, he furnish'd me

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: From mine own library with volumes that

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I prize above my dukedom.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Would I might

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: But ever see that man!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Now I arise:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Resumes his mantle

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Sit still, and hear the last of our sea-sorrow.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Here in this island we arrived; and here

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Have I, thy schoolmaster, made thee more profit

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Than other princesses can that have more time

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For vainer hours and tutors not so careful.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Heavens thank you for't! And now, I pray you, sir,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: For still 'tis beating in my mind, your reason

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: For raising this sea-storm?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Know thus far forth.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: By accident most strange, bountiful Fortune,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Now my dear lady, hath mine enemies

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Brought to this shore; and by my prescience

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I find my zenith doth depend upon

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A most auspicious star, whose influence

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If now I court not but omit, my fortunes

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Will ever after droop. Here cease more questions:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou art inclined to sleep; 'tis a good dulness,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And give it way: I know thou canst not choose.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: MIRANDA sleeps

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come away, servant, come. I am ready now.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Approach, my Ariel, come.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Enter ARIEL

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: All hail, great master! grave sir, hail! I come

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: To answer thy best pleasure; be't to fly,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: To swim, to dive into the fire, to ride

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: On the curl'd clouds, to thy strong bidding task

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Ariel and all his quality.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hast thou, spirit,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Perform'd to point the tempest that I bade thee?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: To every article.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I boarded the king's ship; now on the beak,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Now in the waist, the deck, in every cabin,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I flamed amazement: sometime I'ld divide,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And burn in many places; on the topmast,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: The yards and bowsprit, would I flame distinctly,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Then meet and join. Jove's lightnings, the precursors

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: O' the dreadful thunder-claps, more momentary

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And sight-outrunning were not; the fire and cracks

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Of sulphurous roaring the most mighty Neptune

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Seem to besiege and make his bold waves tremble,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Yea, his dread trident shake.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: My brave spirit!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Who was so firm, so constant, that this coil

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Would not infect his reason?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Not a soul

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: But felt a fever of the mad and play'd

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Some tricks of desperation. All but mariners

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Plunged in the foaming brine and quit the vessel,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Then all afire with me: the king's son, Ferdinand,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: With hair up-staring,--then like reeds, not hair,--

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Was the first man that leap'd; cried, 'Hell is empty

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And all the devils are here.'

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Why that's my spirit!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: But was not this nigh shore?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Close by, my master.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: But are they, Ariel, safe?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Not a hair perish'd;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: On their sustaining garments not a blemish,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: But fresher than before: and, as thou badest me,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: In troops I have dispersed them 'bout the isle.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: The king's son have I landed by himself;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Whom I left cooling of the air with sighs

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: In an odd angle of the isle and sitting,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: His arms in this sad knot.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of the king's ship

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The mariners say how thou hast disposed

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And all the rest o' the fleet.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Safely in harbour

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Is the king's ship; in the deep nook, where once

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Thou call'dst me up at midnight to fetch dew

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: From the still-vex'd Bermoothes, there she's hid:

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: The mariners all under hatches stow'd;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Who, with a charm join'd to their suffer'd labour,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I have left asleep; and for the rest o' the fleet

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Which I dispersed, they all have met again

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And are upon the Mediterranean flote,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Bound sadly home for Naples,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Supposing that they saw the king's ship wreck'd

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And his great person perish.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Ariel, thy charge

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Exactly is perform'd: but there's more work.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What is the time o' the day?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Past the mid season.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: At least two glasses. The time 'twixt six and now

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Must by us both be spent most preciously.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Is there more toil? Since thou dost give me pains,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Let me remember thee what thou hast promised,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Which is not yet perform'd me.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: How now? moody?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What is't thou canst demand?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: My liberty.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Before the time be out? no more!

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I prithee,

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Remember I have done thee worthy service;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Told thee no lies, made thee no mistakings, served

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Without or grudge or grumblings: thou didst promise

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: To bate me a full year.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Dost thou forget

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: From what a torment I did free thee?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: No.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou dost, and think'st it much to tread the ooze

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of the salt deep,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To run upon the sharp wind of the north,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To do me business in the veins o' the earth

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: When it is baked with frost.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I do not, sir.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou liest, malignant thing! Hast thou forgot

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The foul witch Sycorax, who with age and envy

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Was grown into a hoop? hast thou forgot her?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: No, sir.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou hast. Where was she born? speak; tell me.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Sir, in Argier.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: O, was she so? I must

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Once in a month recount what thou hast been,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which thou forget'st. This damn'd witch Sycorax,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For mischiefs manifold and sorceries terrible

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To enter human hearing, from Argier,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou know'st, was banish'd: for one thing she did

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: They would not take her life. Is not this true?

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Ay, sir.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: This blue-eyed hag was hither brought with child

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And here was left by the sailors. Thou, my slave,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As thou report'st thyself, wast then her servant;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And, for thou wast a spirit too delicate

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To act her earthy and abhorr'd commands,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Refusing her grand hests, she did confine thee,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: By help of her more potent ministers

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And in her most unmitigable rage,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Into a cloven pine; within which rift

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Imprison'd thou didst painfully remain

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A dozen years; within which space she died

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And left thee there; where thou didst vent thy groans

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As fast as mill-wheels strike. Then was this island--

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Save for the son that she did litter here,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A freckled whelp hag-born--not honour'd with

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A human shape.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Yes, Caliban her son.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Dull thing, I say so; he, that Caliban

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Whom now I keep in service. Thou best know'st

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What torment I did find thee in; thy groans

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Did make wolves howl and penetrate the breasts

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Of ever angry bears: it was a torment

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To lay upon the damn'd, which Sycorax

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Could not again undo: it was mine art,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: When I arrived and heard thee, that made gape

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The pine and let thee out.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I thank thee, master.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If thou more murmur'st, I will rend an oak

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And peg thee in his knotty entrails till

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou hast howl'd away twelve winters.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Pardon, master;

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: I will be correspondent to command

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: And do my spiriting gently.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Do so, and after two days

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I will discharge thee.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: That's my noble master!

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: What shall I do? say what; what shall I do?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Go make thyself like a nymph o' the sea: be subject

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To no sight but thine and mine, invisible

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To every eyeball else. Go take this shape

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And hither come in't: go, hence with diligence!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Exit ARIEL

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Awake, dear heart, awake! thou hast slept well; Awake!

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: The strangeness of your story put

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Heaviness in me.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Shake it off. Come on;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: We'll visit Caliban my slave, who never

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Yields us kind answer.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: 'Tis a villain, sir,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I do not love to look on.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: But, as 'tis,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: We cannot miss him: he does make our fire,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fetch in our wood and serves in offices

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: That profit us. What, ho! slave! Caliban!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou earth, thou! speak.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: [Within]  There's wood enough within.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come forth, I say! there's other business for thee:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come, thou tortoise! when?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Re-enter ARIEL like a water-nymph

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fine apparition! My quaint Ariel,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hark in thine ear.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: My lord it shall be done.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou poisonous slave, got by the devil himself

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Upon thy wicked dam, come forth!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Enter CALIBAN

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: As wicked dew as e'er my mother brush'd

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: With raven's feather from unwholesome fen

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Drop on you both! a south-west blow on ye

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And blister you all o'er!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For this, be sure, to-night thou shalt have cramps,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Side-stitches that shall pen thy breath up; urchins

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Shall, for that vast of night that they may work,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: All exercise on thee; thou shalt be pinch'd

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As thick as honeycomb, each pinch more stinging

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Than bees that made 'em.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I must eat my dinner.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: This island's mine, by Sycorax my mother,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Which thou takest from me. When thou camest first,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou strokedst me and madest much of me, wouldst give me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Water with berries in't, and teach me how

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: To name the bigger light, and how the less,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: That burn by day and night: and then I loved thee

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: And show'd thee all the qualities o' the isle,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The fresh springs, brine-pits, barren place and fertile:

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Cursed be I that did so! All the charms

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Of Sycorax, toads, beetles, bats, light on you!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For I am all the subjects that you have,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Which first was mine own king: and here you sty me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: In this hard rock, whiles you do keep from me

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: The rest o' the island.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou most lying slave,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Whom stripes may move, not kindness! I have used thee,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Filth as thou art, with human care, and lodged thee

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: In mine own cell, till thou didst seek to violate

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The honour of my child.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: O ho, O ho! would't had been done!

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Thou didst prevent me; I had peopled else

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: This isle with Calibans.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Abhorred slave,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Which any print of goodness wilt not take,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Being capable of all ill! I pitied thee,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Took pains to make thee speak, taught thee each hour

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: One thing or other: when thou didst not, savage,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Know thine own meaning, but wouldst gabble like

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A thing most brutish, I endow'd thy purposes

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With words that made them known. But thy vile race,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Though thou didst learn, had that in't which

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: good natures

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Could not abide to be with; therefore wast thou

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Deservedly confined into this rock,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Who hadst deserved more than a prison.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: You taught me language; and my profit on't

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Is, I know how to curse. The red plague rid you

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: For learning me your language!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hag-seed, hence!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fetch us in fuel; and be quick, thou'rt best,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To answer other business. Shrug'st thou, malice?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If thou neglect'st or dost unwillingly

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What I command, I'll rack thee with old cramps,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Fill all thy bones with aches, make thee roar

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: That beasts shall tremble at thy din.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: No, pray thee.

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: Aside

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: I must obey: his art is of such power,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: It would control my dam's god, Setebos,

speaker: CALIBAN
text_entry: and make a vassal of him.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: So, slave; hence!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Exit CALIBAN

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Re-enter ARIEL, invisible, playing and singing; FERDINAND following

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: ARIEL'S song.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come unto these yellow sands,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And then take hands:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Courtsied when you have and kiss'd

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The wild waves whist,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Foot it featly here and there;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And, sweet sprites, the burthen bear.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hark, hark!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Burthen [dispersedly, within

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The watch-dogs bark!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Burthen Bow-wow

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hark, hark! I hear

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The strain of strutting chanticleer

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Cry, Cock-a-diddle-dow.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Where should this music be? i' the air or the earth?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: It sounds no more: and sure, it waits upon

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Some god o' the island. Sitting on a bank,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Weeping again the king my father's wreck,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: This music crept by me upon the waters,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Allaying both their fury and my passion

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: With its sweet air: thence I have follow'd it,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Or it hath drawn me rather. But 'tis gone.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No, it begins again.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: ARIEL sings

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Full fathom five thy father lies;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Of his bones are coral made;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Those are pearls that were his eyes:

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Nothing of him that doth fade

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: But doth suffer a sea-change

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Into something rich and strange.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Sea-nymphs hourly ring his knell

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Burthen Ding-dong

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Hark! now I hear them,--Ding-dong, bell.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The ditty does remember my drown'd father.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: This is no mortal business, nor no sound

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: That the earth owes. I hear it now above me.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The fringed curtains of thine eye advance

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And say what thou seest yond.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: What is't? a spirit?

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Lord, how it looks about! Believe me, sir,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: It carries a brave form. But 'tis a spirit.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: No, wench; it eats and sleeps and hath such senses

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As we have, such. This gallant which thou seest

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Was in the wreck; and, but he's something stain'd

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: With grief that's beauty's canker, thou mightst call him

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A goodly person: he hath lost his fellows

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And strays about to find 'em.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I might call him

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: A thing divine, for nothing natural

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I ever saw so noble.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: [Aside] It goes on, I see,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As my soul prompts it. Spirit, fine spirit! I'll free thee

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Within two days for this.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Most sure, the goddess

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: On whom these airs attend! Vouchsafe my prayer

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: May know if you remain upon this island;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And that you will some good instruction give

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: How I may bear me here: my prime request,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Which I do last pronounce, is, O you wonder!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: If you be maid or no?

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: No wonder, sir;

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: But certainly a maid.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: My language! heavens!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I am the best of them that speak this speech,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Were I but where 'tis spoken.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: How? the best?

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What wert thou, if the King of Naples heard thee?

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: A single thing, as I am now, that wonders

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To hear thee speak of Naples. He does hear me;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And that he does I weep: myself am Naples,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Who with mine eyes, never since at ebb, beheld

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The king my father wreck'd.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Alack, for mercy!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Yes, faith, and all his lords; the Duke of Milan

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And his brave son being twain.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: [Aside] The Duke of Milan

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And his more braver daughter could control thee,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: If now 'twere fit to do't. At the first sight

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: They have changed eyes. Delicate Ariel,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I'll set thee free for this.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To FERDINAND

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: A word, good sir;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I fear you have done yourself some wrong: a word.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Why speaks my father so ungently? This

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Is the third man that e'er I saw, the first

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: That e'er I sigh'd for: pity move my father

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: To be inclined my way!

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: O, if a virgin,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: And your affection not gone forth, I'll make you

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The queen of Naples.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Soft, sir! one word more.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Aside

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: They are both in either's powers; but this swift business

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I must uneasy make, lest too light winning

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Make the prize light.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To FERDINAND

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: One word more; I charge thee

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: That thou attend me: thou dost here usurp

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The name thou owest not; and hast put thyself

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Upon this island as a spy, to win it

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: From me, the lord on't.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No, as I am a man.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: There's nothing ill can dwell in such a temple:

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: If the ill spirit have so fair a house,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Good things will strive to dwell with't.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Follow me.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Speak not you for him; he's a traitor. Come;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: I'll manacle thy neck and feet together:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Sea-water shalt thou drink; thy food shall be

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: The fresh-brook muscles, wither'd roots and husks

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Wherein the acorn cradled. Follow.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: No;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: I will resist such entertainment till

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Mine enemy has more power.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Draws, and is charmed from moving

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: O dear father,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Make not too rash a trial of him, for

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: He's gentle and not fearful.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: What? I say,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: My foot my tutor? Put thy sword up, traitor;

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Who makest a show but darest not strike, thy conscience

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Is so possess'd with guilt: come from thy ward,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: For I can here disarm thee with this stick

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And make thy weapon drop.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Beseech you, father.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hence! hang not on my garments.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Sir, have pity;

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: I'll be his surety.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Silence! one word more

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Shall make me chide thee, if not hate thee. What!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: An advocate for an imposter! hush!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou think'st there is no more such shapes as he,

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Having seen but him and Caliban: foolish wench!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To the most of men this is a Caliban

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And they to him are angels.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: My affections

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Are then most humble; I have no ambition

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: To see a goodlier man.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come on; obey:

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thy nerves are in their infancy again

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: And have no vigour in them.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: So they are;

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: My spirits, as in a dream, are all bound up.

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: My father's loss, the weakness which I feel,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: The wreck of all my friends, nor this man's threats,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: To whom I am subdued, are but light to me,

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Might I but through my prison once a day

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Behold this maid: all corners else o' the earth

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Let liberty make use of; space enough

speaker: FERDINAND
text_entry: Have I in such a prison.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: [Aside]                It works.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To FERDINAND

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come on.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou hast done well, fine Ariel!

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To FERDINAND

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Follow me.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: To ARIEL

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Hark what thou else shalt do me.

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Be of comfort;

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: My father's of a better nature, sir,

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Than he appears by speech: this is unwonted

speaker: MIRANDA
text_entry: Which now came from him.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Thou shalt be free

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: As mountain winds: but then exactly do

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: All points of my command.

speaker: ARIEL
text_entry: To the syllable.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Come, follow. Speak not for him.

speaker: PROSPERO
text_entry: Exeunt
